text: well the first thing I'd like to do is
can thank my own supporters for the
faith that they showed in me in this
leadership election we finished the
first day of nominations Owen Smith has
a lead and I think that it's in the best
interest of the Labour Party that we now
come together so that we can have one
candidate so I'm announcing tonight that
I'm withdrawing from this race and
supporting Owen I'd like to congratulate
Owen on coming top in this race and then
going on I think to take on Jeremy
Corbyn we have a Labour Party at the
moment that is not working we've got a
leader that doesn't have the confidence
of his members of parliament and isn't
reaching out to the country we need to
have a strong and United Labour Party so
that we can be a good opposition take
the fight to the Conservative government
and heal our country so I am announcing
tonight that I will be supporting Owen
in that endeavor with all of my
enthusiasm and might and I'd also like
to say to the people outside watching
this if you are a supporter of the
Labour Party and you want the Labour
Party to be an effective opposition who
can take on the Tories and win please
go to the Labour Party website sign up
as a registered supporter and join this
fight you have till five o'clock
tomorrow thank you very much have you
done a deal with Owens with who you take
a job would you take any job working
alongside him in his cabinet I'm
supporting Owen we are we are going to
be in lockstep together arguing for an
effective United Labour Party doing its
job as her majesty's opposition and
opposing this Tory government what was
the gap between your candidacy well
there was a there was quite a narrow gap
but when I looked at the results I
didn't think that it was in the
interests of the party that this carried
on it's now important that people
register as supporters so that we can
take the battle
for the future of the Labour Party out
into the country thank you very much
so what do you think is going on I think
there will be sighs of relief amongst
Labour MPs tonight that they have got
one candidate there will be some who are
upset that it's not Angela eagle but I
think in the end the turmoil that
there's been in the party and the desire
amongst MPs to try and get in a new
leader because they've lost confidence
in Jeremy Corbyn that is the
overwhelming feeling I think now so as
she said there are made very clear
they're going to come together now and
fight mr. Corbin over the summer in the
hope they would see it of saving the
Labour Party and as you heard there her
making her picture add to people out
there to join up as registered members
so they can take part in the leadership
vote the ballot because they want to try
and make that sure that it's a different
result from last time round last summer
of course remember hundreds of thousands
of people joining the Labour Party
Jeremy Corbyn inspiring people some of
whom had never voted before or been
involved in politics before but what
Labour MPs are hoping is that that mood
has now changed that they've watched him
in the last few months that they've
realized that he is not leadership
material and that they will listen
frankly to their MPs many of whom do
share some of mr corbyn's views many of
whom really did want to make it work but
who felt that he just doesn't have the
leadership qualities so that's going to
be the battle now and I think people
will be in the labour party in the
parliament will be very relieved that
they have now one candidate Owen Smith
so all eyes really will be on him now
he's an unknown quantity to many people
it will be interesting to see how well
the reaction is from Labour Party
members who may not know him as well as
they know Angela Eagle will that be a
benefit to him or will it be a drawback
he often talks of himself as being from
the soft left of the party after the
2015 election defeat he said that Labour
had not done enough to reassure people
they could be trusted with the economy
he will be seen as a fresh face by many
and that may well be to his advantage
but jeremy corbyn's people very
confident that the result will be the
same as it was last year and they will
come back here at the end of september
with mr corbyn's still in place well one
thing we do know about Owen Smith and
some of us have known him for some time
Vicky is that he is a very very
combative campaigner so
I think we can guarantee that this
campaign over the summer especially with
the mr. Corbyn supporters who are
equally combative this is not going to
be a polite contest this is going to be
pretty hard for it yeah it is actually
actually say Owen Smith who worked for
the BBC for very many years before going
into policy and communications for a
pharmaceutical company he has never made
any secret of the fact that he would
like to be Labour leader one day and it
it raised eyebrows I mean he was openly
ambitious saying that yes last time
around he supported Andy Burnham the
shadow home secretary but said at the
time one day he would like to be leader
well now he's putting that into action
he's going to go out there with his
message whatever that's going to be and
as I say because it will be potentially
a new message he could draw some support
from mr. Corbyn it will be interesting
to see what mr corbyn's team think about
having him as their challenger rather
than Angela Eagle who was a much better
known and I think they thought that she
might well not attract so much support
because for example she voted for the
Iraq war so we'll see whether Owen Smith
ends up being a tougher opponent at for
mr. Corbyn than he faced last time
around
